title: The top meta is destroyed... again.
body:
So now Teleport has been nerfed again God knows why, and Ignite deals much more damage than before, so the only viable champions in the toplane are bully laners with Ignite that automatically wins the laning phase.

So awesome to see Riot can't balance the toplane and clearly doesn't even care about it. The most useless position and the less variety of viable champions in a lane since early season 7, with a super boring idea of "counterpick or get counterpicked" because the place is full of bully laners, hard counters and ridiculous champions like Fiora or Irelia. 

Another role I can't play properly because I don't feel like playing the 3-4 champions that are absurdly broken in each patch. Let's put it in my list of "I don't want to play this bullshit role rigth now" with jungler and support. 

Great.... {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

Top is now the 'Retard Lane of the Rift', full of Nasus, Wu, Panth, Tryn, Singed and Garen.
Who the hell keeps buffing shits like this.
The only thing we need is a Teemo buff to complete the ruination.
Teemo actually needs it... He has been hit with waay too many indirect nerfs.
Like what ? I don't know much about what nerfs can have a bad impact on teemo :x

{{item:3147}} blackout passive itself + recent change that allows to oneshot shrooms. 
{{item:3364}} available earlier. 
New runes for item CDR.
{{item:3151}} removal of penetration. 
{{champion:555}} shits on his shrooms due to his broken passive (he will just regenerate 80% of dmg taken)
Teemo is quite bad with burst or very mobile champions which is... Everyone those days.
For CC he has slows... Which largely ignored by dashes and blind which works the best on AA reliant champions... Most of which almost extinct. 
Even {{champion:23}} goes AP those days and just spins all over his face. Most hilarious is that he apparently still can deal dmg with procs of rageblade even while blinded and it actually hurts considering that its impossible to just burst down tryndamere.  
Removal of deathfire touch. 
Shitty runes allocation. 
If you want actually useful keystone that wont work against you by revealing your location in dumbest way like aery or meteor you will need to go something other than sorcery. Which will leave you without manaband and almost without mana as results. Most of efficient itemization paths will leave him completely without mana.
 If you will take manaband as secondary you wont be able to take resolve and boneplating which isnt nice. 
{{item:3085}} cost increase. He wasnt biggest Runaan user but its still was a thing. 
8.9 nerf to mana. Fuck me if i know why. Single mana item teemo builds is {{item:3100}} . And it does not even happen that often. 
Q started to draw aggro from minions
After give away of free stats he promptly got robbed of 40% of them. 

He had none of those problems in previous season. And even more. His poison worked in interesting ways with several items and abilities. Like {{item:3303}} or trunderlord. 

Thats just some of the things that i could remember. 
He received some direct nerfs in this season but the only buff that he enjoyed was ignite buff. Questionable how happy he should be about that since every burst oriented opponent of his gonna have that.
Maybe if your E wasn't some godlike harass tool, maybe he might get buffs.

Not gonna argue how godlike it is but there are other ways to buff him without breaking him and making him true incarnation of evil again. 

You know some things like - revert nerfs to mana. At least partially, so you wont be FORCED to go manaflow band. 
Or make blind actually work on something. A lot of... More fresh... champions ignore his blind almost completely. Things just isnt consistent at all on that side. Lot of abilities work as AA and proc on hit effects and such but completely ignore blind from Teemo. Versus some champions it completely denies you any possibility of counterplay. He might feel like real champion and not just some AP hamster after that. 

Increase duration on shrooms. Even 30 seconds would feel really nice. Or give them more vision radius. There is a lot of things that wont impact his combat ability directly but would make him stronger anyway. 

Considering the fact that with his playrate and simplicity of his kit he tends to sink below 50% winrate quite often those days it might not be such bad idea.

God I hope the enemy team picks Irelia into me.

fuck me that was a bad experience.

Also I am personally stopping myself from taking ignite, in hope that my enemy laner doesn't kill himself after playing against me.

The only use for teleport on {{champion:14}} 

1. cheese enemy buff + first wave to troll bot your lane opponent and enemy jungler
2. after 6 ult down midlane or botlane into immobile opponents your kit at that point  has enough damage to oneshot them with a full combo you can then teleport back to lane after stealing all your allies cs and killing one two or 3 enemies

Not sure how you used it but that is pretty much what teleport is for 
I mean it takes 4,5 seconds to teleport then at least 2-3 seconds before you can contribute anything usefull due to your slow ass kit by then your enemy has recalled 

Other then that i would suggest smite as it has a really short cooldown for a combat summoner and you can then grab cinderhulk 
Ignite has it's uses for obvious reasons

Or be cheesy and grab exhaust not many people do this and you can use it to bait enemies into tower diving and get double kills because they forgot about it
Or use it a split second prior to your death and get an easy revenge kill 
It's often better then ignite or barrier in a 1v1 fight in terms of how much damage it blocks vs how much ignite deals 
And it can be used to peel in team fights 

right now teleport is really bad and i wouldn't really take it on Sion anymore

Dude, do you know how hard toplane gets camped in certain cases? Toplane is 10% of the time skill matchup, 20% of the time 'are you vs Quinn?', '70% of the time who was jungle influence on their side'.

If tanks aren't the strongest top lane picks, it will always be a mess. It isn't "fixed" when fighters and bruisers are dominating top so easily because the counter picks are so one-sided. And there is nothing you can do to hold the lane in the one-sided counter match ups. You just pray that your team wins 4v4 so you have a chance to actually escape the lane and do something meaningful on the map.

If tanks dominate top lane then it essentially becomes a boring farming fiesta where trades are worthless and top lane starts being ignored because no jgler wants to waste time trying to kill a tank. Top laners hate the tank top only meta because you have very minimal impact and you are left at the mercy of your carries to be healthy once team fighting starts. you essentially become the second support.

That is exactly how I like my top lane. I would prefer it if every lane wasn't doing sustained burst damage and at least have one lane that can provide a tank and utility.

Your impact on the game can be decided by lane manipulation and roaming plays rather than who picked the champion who can deal the most damage in the shortest amount of time.

If your carries go 0-5 then you're screwed because tanks can't solo carry. That is why top laners don't like tanks because your entire impact on the game is dependent on your carries being healthy when you group up with them. Thanks for making it clear that you don't want us top laners to have carry potential and have a real impact on the other then hoping our bot lane doesn't feed.

If you are consistent, you will win more often than you lose in that meta. You are talking to someone who plays nothing but top lane to climb whenever I lose too much elo from fooling around. Earlier this season, I won 16 Maokai games in a row when Maokai wasn't even a favorable pick. That was BEFORE the bruiser and fighter meta of course. 

That said, you skipped the point I made in the very first post. When you are counter picked in the top lane as a fighter/bruiser, you have no say at all over the game. You are entirely dependent on your team winning 4v4 and 4v5 (When the enemy top laner shoves you in and roams) which throws your "carry potential" out of the window. You have absolutely nothing in your kit that allows you to play from a major deficit. 

I see you playing Darius, Yorick, and Garen. These are all champions who can't do shit when they are counter picked or playing from behind. Granted, Yorick can play just about any matchup so I will grant you that at least. However, Yorick is still also heavily reliant on the team to not fight and hold turrets while you split. Which is asking a whole lot in low elos. He is as vulnerable as playing a tank with carries that don't follow up. Just in a different way.
